The Jet Propulsion Laboratory\'s Dr. Charles Elachi, a pioneer in the development and use of spaceborne imaging radar for scientific studies of Earth and other planets, has been awarded the 2000 Dryden Lectureship in Research by the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) in recognition of the importance of his research to the advancement of aeronautics and astronautics.


Date: 2000-01-12 21:01:00

[![NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of
Technology](http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/images/){width="100"
height="75"}](http://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/&rn=news.xml&rst=4972)\
\
The Jet Propulsion Laboratory\'s Dr. Charles Elachi, a pioneer in the
development and use of spaceborne imaging radar for scientific studies
of Earth and other planets, has been awarded the 2000 Dryden Lectureship
in Research by the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics
(AIAA) in recognition of the importance of his research to the
advancement of aeronautics and astronautics.

\
\
